item.title: How to Write a Philosophy Paper
item.description: How to Write a Philosophy Paper The Goal of a Philosophy Paper Question What makes a philosophy paper successful? Answer A successful philosophy paper does two things: 1. It makes an argument for a specific claim; i.e., it defends a thesis! 2. The argument it makes is intelligible and convincing to the reader as well. Planning a Successful Philosophy Paper Step 1: Select a thesis Exercise: What theses address the TP1 prompt?

item.title: Unit 0.1
item.description:
Introducing Modern Philosophy Why devote a course in the history of Western European philosophy to the 
th{17} and 
th{18} centuries? The reason may not be obvious. For one thing, philosophy in Europe is far \emph{older} than the 
th{17} century; it stretches at least as far back as the ancient Greeks in the 
th{6} century CE, perhaps even further, finding its ultimate roots in the speculations of ancient Egyptians and Babylonians centuries before.
